alert.note: Alert for Broadwater; Jefferson (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 1:29PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Scattered thunderstorms are Developing across the Boulder and Elkhorn Mountains and will move east across portions of Broadwater and Jefferson Counties through 230 PM MDT... At 125 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm 7 miles north of Townsend, moving east at 20 mph and additional storms developing to the west near Boulder and Basin. These storms will likely begin to produce lightning shortly, along with brief rainfall and gusty winds excess of 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Townsend, Boulder, Montana City, Basin, Wickes, Alhambra, Corbin, Elkhorn State Park, Winston, Silos, Clancy, Jefferson City and Goose Bay. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 145 and 190. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 22, and between mile markers 55 and 85. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. These storms will be near or over Canyon Ferry Lake through 2:30 pm. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
